fields.description:
[PREF DISCRIMINATION]

ACAS stands for Advisory, Conciliation and Arbitration Service. The ACAS helpline answers employment questions confidentially by phone. It takes queries from employers, employees and others on a wide range of employment law matters. 

The ACAS helpline offers general legal information only - they don't give advice on specific situations. ACAS will provide a free conciliation service known as pre-claim conciliation for workplace problems that can't be resolved in-house and are likely to become employment tribunal claims.
fields.accessibility: Text relay and Welsh helpline service available.Website has range of features including read aloud service and resizeable text.
fields.when_to_use: Clients seeking legal advice for out of scope employment and discrimination problems
fields.how_to_use: Refer those who wish to self help to website. Refer those needing guidance to helpline.
fields.public_description: The ACAS helpline answers employment questions confidentially by phone. It provides general legal information to both employers and employees on  employment law matters, and offers a free conciliation service for workplace problems that can't be resolved in-house.
fields.keywords: employment, helpline, employers, contract, tribunal, grievance, employee, redundancy, misconduct, maternity, redundant, dismissal, wage, helpline, stress, absence, ACAS, acas

fields.description:
AVMA promotes better patient safety and seeks justice for those affected by a medical accident or clinical negligence. 

Medically and legally trained caseworkers provide free and confidential support following a medical accident. This includes rights advice, referral to solicitors and other practical and emotional support. 

The AVMA website features a range of specialist leaflets, as well as an online solicitor search.
fields.accessibility: Website available in Welsh
fields.when_to_use: Clients on a low income seeking legal advice after a medical accident.
fields.how_to_use: Refer those wishing to self help to website, those who wish to speak to to someone to helpline.
fields.public_description: AVMA provides support for those affected by a medical accident or clinical negligence. Medically and legally trained caseworkers provide free and confidential help following a medical accident. This includes rights advice, referral to solicitors and other practical and emotional support.
fields.address:
Action against Medical Accidents

Christopher Wren Yard 


117 High Street


Croydon     


CR0 1QG
fields.keywords: action, medical, accidents, negligence, clinical, doctor, nurse, gp, nhs, hospital, surgery, injury, patient, avma, helpline

fields.description:
The CQC is the new health and adult social care regulator for England. It aims to ensure better care for everyone in hospital, in a care home or at home.

The CQC regulates services provided by the NHS, local councils, private companies and voluntary organisations.
If offers:

* advice on making a complaint about a health or care service provider.
* information about services currently available.
* information about the standards and regulations that a care service provider should meet
fields.accessibility: Email, Browsealoud, some information in other formats and languages, including BSL
fields.when_to_use: Refer clients with concerns about care services in hospitals, care homes, dental and GP surgeries, and all other care services
fields.how_to_use: Refer those who are able to self help to website and those who need assistance to helpline.
fields.public_description: The CQC is the new health and adult social care regulator for England. It aims to ensure better care for everyone in hospital, in a care home or at home. You can contact the CQC for advice on making a complaint about a health or social care provider.
fields.keywords: care, quality, commission, cqc, social, home, regulator, regulates, health, carer, helpline

fields.description:
[PREF FAMILY]

Child Maintenance Options is a confidential and impartial helpline that is separate to the Child Support Agency (CSA) and provides free information about how to put in place maintenance arrangements for children.

Child Maintenance Options can't advise on disputes concerning existing child support arrangements made through the CSA. Please refer these callers to the CSA instead.

fields.how_to_use: Refer clients wanting to self-help to websites and those who need more support to helpline

fields.description:
The Disability Law Service (DLS) provides information and advice to disabled people. DLS is run by and for disabled people as an independent, national registered charity. Disabled people and their families, carers and advocates can call the helpline for advice. 

DLS only provides advice and information in these six areas of law:

* disability discrimination
* consumer
* community care
* further and higher education
* employment
* welfare benefits (GREATER LONDON ONLY)

Please note that the Disability Law Centre deals with education law enquiries.

DLS also provides a casework service, and support at any level of the legal system.
fields.accessibility: Online Advice
fields.when_to_use: Clients seeking advice or information for disability-related legal issues
fields.how_to_use: Refer those willing to self-help to factsheets, those who need advice to helpline.
fields.public_description: The Disability Law Service (DLS) provides information and advice to disabled people. DLS is run by and for disabled people as an independent, national registered charity. Disabled people and their families, carers and advocates can call the helpline for advice.

London


EC1V 8AF

fields.type_of_service: Education advice for parents of children and young people with autism or Aspergers syndrome
fields.description:
This helpline is managed by the National Autistic Society to provide advice on educational provision for parents and carers whose children have autism or Asperger syndrome. 

The helpline can help parents get appropriate education for their child and provides advice on issues which include: 

* getting extra help at school
* statutory assessments
* annual reviews
* exclusions
* admissions
fields.accessibility: Online enquiry form & email. Various accessibility features on website including visual display settings, BrowseAloud and Welsh language. List of information resources in other languages.
fields.when_to_use: Clients with autism seeking advice for education matters
fields.how_to_use: Refer those who wish to self help to website. Tell those needing guidance to contact helpline - not suitable for urgent cases - this will be a call back service. Client will need to provide name, number, brief details of why they are contacting and best times to call back. Will usually receive a call within a few days.
fields.public_description: This helpline is managed by the National Autistic Society to provide advice on educational provision for parents and carers whose children have autism or Asperger syndrome.
fields.keywords: education, rights, sen, special, educational, needs, autism, aspergers, autistic, asperger

fields.description:
[PREF DISCRIMINATION]

If a client has an employment discrimination query please make sure they have spoken to ACAS first before referring to EASS.

Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS) champions equality and human rights for all, working to eliminate discrimination, reduce inequality, protect human rights and to build good relations, ensuring that everyone has a fair chance to participate in society.The new service is for people who need more expert advice and support on discrimination than advice agencies and other local organisations can provide. 

It will give bespoke advice to individuals across the whole of Great Britain on discrimination issues. It will explain legal rights and remedies within discrimination legislation, across the three nations. It will explain options for informal resolution and help people to pursue them. It will refer people who cannot or do not wish to go down this road to conciliation or mediation services. It will help people who need or want to seek a legal solution by helping to establish eligibility for legal aid and if they are not eligible, to find an accessible legal service or to prepare and lodge a claim themselves.
fields.accessibility: Text phone, letter or email or Skype (BSL users)
fields.when_to_use: Clients seeking advice and support on discrimination and human rights issues
fields.how_to_use: Refer those who wish to self help to 'Ask a Question' search function. Refer those needing advice, support or to look for local sources of help helpline.
fields.public_description: Equality, Advisory and Support Service (EASS) offers personalised advice on discrimination issues throughout the UK. It will help people who are not eligible for legal aid to find an accessible legal service or to prepare and lodge a claim themselves. If you have an employment discrimination problem, please speak to ACAS before you call EASS.
fields.address: FREEPOST EQUALITY ADVISORY SUPPORT SERVICE FPN4431
fields.keywords: equality, advisory, support, services, human, rights, commission, race, disability, civil, discrimination, liberties, EASS, employment

fields.description:
[PREF EDUCATION]
Independent Parental Special Education Advice (IPSEA) is a registered charity offering free and independent advice to parents of children with special educational needs in England and Wales on:

* local authorities' legal duties to assess and provide for children with special educational needs 
* exclusions of children with special needs or disabilities
* action or inaction by local authorities and/or schools which discriminates against children with disabilities 

IPSEA is a  volunteer-based organisation and many of the volunteers providing telephone advice and tribunal support are themselves parents of children with special educational needs.
fields.accessibility: Call back booking service, email information service
fields.when_to_use: Clients seeking legal advice regarding children with special educational needs
fields.how_to_use:
Refer those who wish to self help to website. Refer those who have right of appeal against LEA decision regarding SEN or who want advice about making disability discrimination claim to helpline. Subject to availability.





For Tribunal appeals use: http://www.ipsea.org.uk/How-we-can-help/Tribunal-Helpline.aspx
fields.public_description:
Independent Parental Special Education Advice (IPSEA) is a registered charity offering free and independent adviceto parents of children with special educational needs in England and Wales on:

* local authorities' legal duties to assess and provide for children with special educational needs

* exclusions of children with special needs or disabilities

* action or inaction by local authorities and/or schools whichdiscriminates against children with disabilities
fields.keywords: ipsea, education, parental, parent, special, independent, educational, school, sen, disability, discrimination

fields.description:

* teaching and facilities
* student accommodation
* research supervision
* welfare
* discrimination - race, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation or religious belief

* placements
* maladministration
* procedural irregularities
* unfair practices
* disciplinary matters, including plagiarism
* fitness to practise issues

fields.description:
[PREF DEBT]
Step Change Debt Charity (formerly The Consumer Credit Counselling Service) is an independent registered charity dedicated to providing free, confidential and impartial advice to people in financial distress. They can complete a full financial assessment and, if you're eligible, they will set up a debt management plan. They may also offer free advice on individual voluntary arrangements, bankruptcy and token payments. Step Change Debt Charity will deal with third parties but they need written permission to do so. 

IMPORTANT - Please only refer clients to Step Change Debt Charity if they are ineligible for advice from CLA and have more than one unsecured and uncontested debt and a regular income. Step Change Debt Charity can help clients with priority debts as long as they have other non-priority debts. If a client is on a means-tested benefit they should be referred to one of our specialists in the first instance.

Step Change Debt Charity provides advice by email and live chat
fields.accessibility: Options on website, Request a call back
fields.when_to_use: Clients seeking advice for debt-related issues.
fields.how_to_use: Refer clients seeking advice to helpline, those willing to self help to website
fields.public_description: Step Change Debt Charity provides free, confidential and impartial advice to people in financial distress.They can complete a full financial assessment and, if you're eligible, they will set up a debt management plan. They may also offer free advice on individual voluntary arrangements, bankruptcy and token payments.
fields.address: Wade House, Merrion Centre, Leeds, LS2 8NG
fields.keywords: step, change, debt, charity, cccs, counselling, money, manage, management, finances, financial, loan, loans, debt, debts, arrear, arrears, creditors, creditor, iva, bankrupt, bankruptcy

fields.type_of_service: Issues affecting those who are lesbian, gay or bisexual
fields.description:
Stonewall is a charity that campaigns for equality and justice for lesbians, gay men and bisexuals. The website includes an online information bank that contains information guides relating to lesbian, gay and bisexual issues. The free helpline can offer information on the following issues to individuals, employers and organisations: 

* civil partnerships 
* employment 
* hate crime 
* parenting 
* discrimination 

Stonewall can't give legal advice or help you to pursue a case or complaint, but their trained volunteers and staff aim to put you in touch with the people who can. They can also signpost people towards gay-friendly solicitors and local lesbian, gay and bisexual support groups and services.
fields.when_to_use: Clients who are seeking information in relation to issues relating to gay rights.
fields.how_to_use: Refer clients requiring general information to website, those who require support to helpline
fields.public_description: Stonewall is a charity that campaigns for equality for lesbians, gay men and bisexuals. The free helpline can offer information on issues such as civil partnerships, hate crime, discrimination and employment.

York Road


London SE1 7NX

fields.description:
Victim Supportline offers free, confidential and anonymous support for anyone affected by crime, regardless of whether the crime has been reported to the police or not. 

The supportline directly refers people to their local Victim Support scheme for:

* practical and face-to-face support
* someone to talk to in confidence
* information on police and court procedures 
* help in dealing with other organisations 
* information about compensation and insurance 
* links to other sources of help
* advice for witnesses of crime

Victim Supportline welcomes email enquiries.

fields.type_of_service: Women and children experiencing, or who have experienced, domestic violence Friends and family seeking to support women and children who are experiencing, or who have experienced, domestic violence Professionals supporting women and children experiencing domestic violence.
fields.description:
[PREF FAMILY DV]

The helpline is an emergency service and is not intended to offer general information on domestic violence. Helpline staff respond according to the caller's needs and may refer women (with or without children) to emergency safe accommodation. 

They also provide information about legal, housing or welfare rights and options and referral to relevant services and professions.

Helpline staff can offer emotional support and (if appropriate) refer callers to counselling services. 

As well as offering confidential support and information, helpline staff can provide practical help and information about housing rights and entitlements, information on getting injunctions or reassurance about calling the police.
fields.accessibility: Interpretation service available. Type Talk for calers with hearing difficulties. Womens Aid and Refuge websites provide some information in other languages
fields.when_to_use: Emergency service for women and children who are experiencing, or have experienced, domestic violence. Offer in addition to other resources, including referral to CLA specialist.
fields.how_to_use: To be used as supplement to category specific referrals
fields.public_description:
The helpline is an emergency service and is not intended to offer general information on domestic violence. Helpline staff respond according to the caller's needs and may refer women (with or without children) to emergency safe accommodation. 

They also provide information about legal, housing or welfare rights and options and referral to relevant services and professions.
fields.opening_hours: 24 hours a day, 365 days a year

fields.name: Monday to Friday from 09:00 to 17:30 charged at local call rates
